name: Survey forms mailed, by sampling stratum: 2016
description: Survey forms mailed, by sampling stratum: 2016

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_total_forms_mailed_initially_brdi_1_s_
variableMeasured.description: Total Forms Mailed Initially Brdi 1 S

variableMeasured.name: field_brdi_1_forms_mailed_due_to_reported_data_from_brdi_1_s_forms
variableMeasured.description: Brdi 1 Forms Mailed Due To Reported Data From Brdi 1 S Forms

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Companies were sent the detailed survey form (BRDI-1) if their R&D spending was at least $1.0 million in 2014 or 2015 (except companies that did not respond in these prior 2 years). All other companies received an abbreviated form (BRDI-1(S)). Companies were said to be known to conduct R&D (known positive R&D) if they reported positive R&D in any of the previous 5 survey years. Companies were said to have known zero R&D if they reported zero R&D in at least 1 of the previous 3 survey years and no positive R&D in any of the 5 years. Companies were said to be unknown if no R&D information was available.
sources: National Science Foundation, National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, and U.S. Census Bureau, Business R&D and Innovation Survey, 2016.
